# Product Requirements Document (PRD)

## Product Name: Community-Driven Local Issues Tracker

*(Working title ‚Äì can be renamed later)*

---

## 1. Purpose & Vision

### 1.1 Problem Statement

Local infrastructure issues such as potholes, water leaks, power outages, and garbage accumulation often go unreported or unresolved due to:

* Lack of a centralized reporting platform
* Poor communication between citizens and authorities
* No transparent way to track issue resolution

### 1.2 Solution

A **community-driven digital platform** where citizens can:

* Report local issues with images and location
* Track status updates transparently
* Engage with local authorities through a structured workflow

### 1.3 Vision

Empower citizens to actively participate in improving their neighborhoods while enabling authorities to respond faster, smarter, and more transparently.

---

## 2. Goals & Objectives

### 2.1 Primary Goals

* Provide a simple way for citizens to report local issues
* Ensure transparency through real-time status tracking
* Enable efficient moderation and resolution by authorities

### 2.2 Success Metrics (KPIs)

* Number of issues reported per month
* Average resolution time
* Percentage of issues resolved
* User engagement (active users, repeat reports)
* Admin response time

---

## 3. Target Users

### 3.1 User Personas

#### Citizen (End User)

* Age: 18+
* Uses mobile or web apps
* Wants quick reporting and visibility on resolution

#### Admin / Authority User

* Municipal officers or community moderators
* Responsible for reviewing, assigning, and updating issues

---

## 4. User Stories

### 4.1 Citizen

* As a citizen, I want to report an issue with a photo so it‚Äôs clearly visible.
* As a citizen, I want the issue to be auto-tagged to my location.
* As a citizen, I want to track the status of my reported issues.
* As a citizen, I want to see issues reported by others in my area.

### 4.2 Admin

* As an admin, I want to approve or reject reported issues.
* As an admin, I want to update the issue status.
* As an admin, I want to view all issues on a map.
* As an admin, I want to categorize and prioritize issues.

---

## 5. Functional Requirements

### 5.1 User Authentication

* Optional sign-up/login (Email / OAuth)
* Anonymous reporting (optional ‚Äì configurable)
* Role-based access (Citizen vs Admin)

---

### 5.2 Issue Reporting

**Fields:**

* Issue Title
* Description
* Category (Road, Water, Electricity, Sanitation, Other)
* Image upload (multiple allowed)
* Auto geo-location (GPS / manual pin drop)
* Timestamp

**Requirements:**

* Images compressed before upload
* Validation for required fields
* Location mandatory

---

### 5.3 Geo-Location & Maps

* Interactive map view using Google Maps API
* Pin-based issue visualization
* Color-coded pins based on status
* Filter by category, status, date

---

### 5.4 Issue Status Tracking

**Status Flow:**

1. Reported
2. Under Review
3. Approved
4. In Progress
5. Resolved
6. Rejected

* Status visible to all users
* History of status changes stored

---

### 5.5 Admin Moderation Dashboard

* View all reported issues
* Approve / Reject reports
* Edit issue details if needed
* Assign priority (Low / Medium / High)
* Update status
* Analytics dashboard:

  * Total issues
  * Pending issues
  * Resolved issues

---

### 5.6 Notifications

* Email / in-app notifications for:

  * Issue approval/rejection
  * Status updates
* Optional push notifications (future scope)

---

## 6. Non-Functional Requirements

### 6.1 Performance

* Page load < 3 seconds
* Map rendering optimized for large datasets

### 6.2 Security

* Secure image upload
* Input validation & sanitization
* JWT-based authentication
* Role-based access control

### 6.3 Scalability

* Designed to support multiple cities
* Horizontal scaling for backend services

### 6.4 Accessibility

* Mobile-first design
* WCAG-compliant color contrast
* Keyboard navigation support

---

## 7. Technical Architecture

### 7.1 Frontend

* React.js
* Google Maps API
* Axios for API calls
* Responsive UI (Material UI / Tailwind)

### 7.2 Backend

* Node.js with Express
* RESTful APIs
* JWT Authentication
* Image upload handling (Cloudinary / S3)

### 7.3 Database

* MongoDB
* Collections:

  * Users
  * Issues
  * StatusLogs
  * Categories

---

## 8. Data Model (High-Level)

### Issue Schema

* _id
* title
* description
* category
* images[]
* location { lat, lng }
* status
* priority
* reportedBy
* timestamps
* statusHistory[]

---

## 9. Risks & Mitigations

| Risk                   | Mitigation                      |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------- |
| Spam reports           | CAPTCHA, moderation             |
| False reporting        | Admin approval flow             |
| Low authority adoption | Start with community moderators |
| Privacy concerns       | Location precision controls     |

---

## 10. Future Enhancements

* Mobile app (React Native)
* AI-based issue categorization
* Upvoting issues
* Authority assignment workflows
* Public dashboards for municipalities
* Integration with government APIs

---

## 11. Why This Product Is Unique

* Real-world civic impact
* Transparency-first design
* Community-driven accountability
* Scalable to cities, towns, campuses, and societies
